model.enpal_assessment_project.dim_date.name: dim_date
model.enpal_assessment_project.dim_date.description: Monthly date spine used for consistent month-end reporting buckets.

month_start.name: month_start
month_start.description: Month start date (first day of the month) used for monthly reporting buckets.

month_end.name: month_end
month_end.description: Month end date (last day of the month) used for monthly reporting buckets.

model.enpal_assessment_project.dim_date.raw_code:
-- Monthly date spine used for reporting at month-end grain.
with stage_firsts as (
    select
        stage_entered_at
    from {{ ref('int_pipedrive_deal_stage_firsts') }}
),

sales_calls as (
    select
        first_call_at
    from {{ ref('int_pipedrive_deal_sales_calls') }}
),

all_dates as (
    select stage_entered_at as event_ts from stage_firsts
    union all
    select first_call_at as event_ts from sales_calls
),

bounds as (
    select
        min(event_ts) as min_ts,
        max(event_ts) as max_ts
    from all_dates
),

months as (
    select
        date_trunc('month', dd)::date as month_start,
        (date_trunc('month', dd) + interval '1 month - 1 day')::date as month_end
    from bounds,
         generate_series(
             date_trunc('month', min_ts),
             date_trunc('month', max_ts),
             interval '1 month'
         ) as dd
    where min_ts is not null
      and max_ts is not null
)

select *
from months

model.enpal_assessment_project.int_piped.name: int_pipedrive_deal_stage_events
model.enpal_assessment_project.int_piped.description: Deal stage change events derived from the Pipedrive deal change log, standardized to the funnel stage names.

deal_id.name: deal_id
deal_id.description: Unique identifier for a deal in Pipedrive.

changed_at.name: changed_at
changed_at.description: Timestamp when the change was recorded.

stage_id.name: stage_id
stage_id.description: Unique identifier for the pipeline stage.

stage_name.name: stage_name
stage_name.description: Display name of the pipeline stage.

funnel_stage_name.name: funnel_stage_name
funnel_stage_name.description: Funnel KPI label aligned to the sales process step.

model.enpal_assessment_project.int_piped.raw_code:
-- Extract only stage change events from the deal change log.
with stage_changes as (
    select
        deal_id,
        changed_at,
        -- new_value holds the stage_id when changed_field_key = 'stage_id'
        new_value::int as stage_id
    from {{ ref('stg_pipedrive_deal_changes') }}
    where changed_field_key = 'stage_id'
      and new_value is not null
),

-- Reference mapping of stage_id to stage_name as configured in Pipedrive.
stages as (
    select
        stage_id,
        stage_name
    from {{ ref('stg_pipedrive_stages') }}
),

mapping as (
    select
        stage_name,
        kpi_name
    from {{ ref('funnel_stage_mapping') }}
),

-- Attach canonical KPI names to each stage change event.
joined as (
    select
        sc.deal_id,
        sc.changed_at,
        sc.stage_id,
        s.stage_name,
        mapping.kpi_name as funnel_stage_name
    from stage_changes sc
    left join stages s
        on sc.stage_id = s.stage_id
    left join mapping
        on lower(s.stage_name) = lower(mapping.stage_name)
)

select *
from joined

model.enpal_assessment_project.int_piped.name: int_pipedrive_deal_sales_calls
model.enpal_assessment_project.int_piped.description: First completed Sales Call 1 and Sales Call 2 activities per deal.

deal_id.name: deal_id
deal_id.description: Unique identifier for a deal in Pipedrive.

activity_type_name.name: activity_type_name
activity_type_name.description: Display name for the activity type.

first_call_at.name: first_call_at
first_call_at.description: Timestamp of the first completed sales call for a deal and call type.

model.enpal_assessment_project.int_piped.raw_code:
-- Base activity records with deal linkage and completion status.
with activities as (
    select
        activity_id,
        activity_type,
        deal_id,
        is_done,
        due_at
    from {{ ref('stg_pipedrive_activity') }}
),

-- Activity type metadata to map type keys to human-readable names.
activity_types as (
    select
        activity_type,
        activity_type_name
    from {{ ref('stg_pipedrive_activity_types') }}
),

-- Keep only completed Sales Call 1/2 activities.
sales_calls as (
    select
        a.deal_id,
        t.activity_type_name,
        a.due_at
    from activities a
    inner join activity_types t
        on a.activity_type = t.activity_type
    where t.activity_type_name in ('Sales Call 1', 'Sales Call 2')
      and a.is_done is true
      and a.due_at is not null
),

-- Capture the first completed sales call per deal and call type.
first_calls as (
    select
        deal_id,
        activity_type_name,
        min(due_at) as first_call_at
    from sales_calls
    group by
        deal_id,
        activity_type_name
)

select *
from first_calls

model.enpal_assessment_project.rep_sales.name: rep_sales_funnel_monthly
model.enpal_assessment_project.rep_sales.description:
Monthly funnel KPI counts for deals and sales-call milestones. Each row represents a funnel step for a given month. Assumptions: "Entered each funnel step" is defined as the first time a deal enters
the corresponding stage (or completes Sales Call 1/2) based on the earliest timestamp.
Monthly buckets are based on month-end dates derived from the event timestamp. Caveats: Activity completion relies on Pipedrive activity logging; missed or late updates
will shift counts. If stage names change, update the funnel mapping seeds to keep KPI
labels consistent.

month.name: month
month.description: Month end date (last day of the month) used for monthly reporting buckets.

kpi_name.name: kpi_name
kpi_name.description: Funnel KPI label aligned to the sales process step.

deals_count.name: deals_count
deals_count.description: Count of distinct deals reaching a funnel step during the month.

model.enpal_assessment_project.rep_sales.raw_code:
-- Monthly sales funnel KPI counts with complete month coverage and month-end dates.
with dim_date as (
    select
        month_start,
        month_end
    from {{ ref('dim_date') }}
),

dim_stage as (
    select
        stage_id,
        funnel_step,
        kpi_name
    from {{ ref('dim_stage') }}
),

dim_activity_type as (
    select
        activity_type_name,
        funnel_step,
        kpi_name
    from {{ ref('dim_activity_type') }}
    where funnel_step is not null
),

fct_stage_firsts as (
    select
        deal_id,
        stage_id,
        stage_entered_at
    from {{ ref('fct_deal_stage_firsts') }}
),

fct_sales_calls as (
    select
        deal_id,
        activity_type_name,
        first_call_at
    from {{ ref('fct_deal_sales_calls') }}
),

-- Monthly counts for main stage-based funnel steps (1,2,3...9).
stage_kpis as (
    select
        (date_trunc('month', f.stage_entered_at) + interval '1 month - 1 day')::date as month,
        d.kpi_name as kpi_name,
        d.funnel_step as funnel_step,
        count(distinct f.deal_id) as deals_count
    from fct_stage_firsts f
    inner join dim_stage d
        on f.stage_id = d.stage_id
    where f.stage_entered_at is not null
    group by
        (date_trunc('month', f.stage_entered_at) + interval '1 month - 1 day')::date,
        d.kpi_name,
        d.funnel_step
),

-- Monthly counts for Sales Call 1 (2.1) and Sales Call 2 (3.1).
sales_call_kpis as (
    select
        (date_trunc('month', f.first_call_at) + interval '1 month - 1 day')::date as month,
        d.kpi_name as kpi_name,
        d.funnel_step as funnel_step,
        count(distinct f.deal_id) as deals_count
    from fct_sales_calls f
    inner join dim_activity_type d
        on f.activity_type_name = d.activity_type_name
    where f.first_call_at is not null
    group by
        (date_trunc('month', f.first_call_at) + interval '1 month - 1 day')::date,
        d.kpi_name,
        d.funnel_step
),

-- Combine stage steps and sales-call sub-steps.
unioned as (
    select * from stage_kpis
    union all
    select * from sales_call_kpis
),

-- Full KPI list for cross-join with months.
all_kpis as (
    select kpi_name, funnel_step from dim_stage
    union
    select kpi_name, funnel_step from dim_activity_type
),

-- Create complete grid of month x KPI and fill missing counts with 0.
spined as (
    select
        d.month_end as month,
        k.kpi_name,
        k.funnel_step,
        coalesce(u.deals_count, 0) as deals_count
    from dim_date d
    cross join all_kpis k
    left join unioned u
        on u.month = d.month_end
       and u.kpi_name = k.kpi_name
       and u.funnel_step = k.funnel_step
)

select
    month,
    kpi_name,
    funnel_step,
    deals_count
from spined
order by
    month,
    case funnel_step
        when '1' then 1
        when '2' then 2
        when '2.1' then 3
        when '3' then 4
        when '3.1' then 5
        when '4' then 6
        when '5' then 7
        when '6' then 8
        when '7' then 9
        when '8' then 10
        when '9' then 11
        else 99
    end

    where funnel_step is not null
),

fct_stage_firsts as (
    select
        deal_id,
        stage_id,
        stage_entered_at
    from "postgres"."pipedrive_analytics_pipedrive_analytics"."fct_deal_stage_firsts"
),

fct_sales_calls as (
    select
        deal_id,
        activity_type_name,
        first_call_at
    from "postgres"."pipedrive_analytics_pipedrive_analytics"."fct_deal_sales_calls"
),

-- Monthly counts for main stage-based funnel steps (1,2,3...9).
stage_kpis as (
    select
        (date_trunc('month', f.stage_entered_at) + interval '1 month - 1 day')::date as month,
        d.kpi_name as kpi_name,
        d.funnel_step as funnel_step,
        count(distinct f.deal_id) as deals_count
    from fct_stage_firsts f
    inner join dim_stage d
        on f.stage_id = d.stage_id
    where f.stage_entered_at is not null
    group by
        (date_trunc('month', f.stage_entered_at) + interval '1 month - 1 day')::date,
        d.kpi_name,
        d.funnel_step
),

-- Monthly counts for Sales Call 1 (2.1) and Sales Call 2 (3.1).
sales_call_kpis as (
    select
        (date_trunc('month', f.first_call_at) + interval '1 month - 1 day')::date as month,
        d.kpi_name as kpi_name,
        d.funnel_step as funnel_step,
        count(distinct f.deal_id) as deals_count
    from fct_sales_calls f
    inner join dim_activity_type d
        on f.activity_type_name = d.activity_type_name
    where f.first_call_at is not null
    group by
        (date_trunc('month', f.first_call_at) + interval '1 month - 1 day')::date,
        d.kpi_name,
        d.funnel_step
),

-- Combine stage steps and sales-call sub-steps.
unioned as (
    select * from stage_kpis
    union all
    select * from sales_call_kpis
),

-- Full KPI list for cross-join with months.
all_kpis as (
    select kpi_name, funnel_step from dim_stage
    union
    select kpi_name, funnel_step from dim_activity_type
),

-- Create complete grid of month x KPI and fill missing counts with 0.
spined as (
    select
        d.month_end as month,
        k.kpi_name,
        k.funnel_step,
        coalesce(u.deals_count, 0) as deals_count
    from dim_date d
    cross join all_kpis k
    left join unioned u
        on u.month = d.month_end
       and u.kpi_name = k.kpi_name
       and u.funnel_step = k.funnel_step
)

select
    month,
    kpi_name,
    funnel_step,
    deals_count
from spined
order by
    month,
    case funnel_step
        when '1' then 1
        when '2' then 2
        when '2.1' then 3
        when '3' then 4
        when '3.1' then 5
        when '4' then 6
        when '5' then 7
        when '6' then 8
        when '7' then 9
        when '8' then 10
        when '9' then 11
        else 99
    end

macro.dbt_postgres.postgres__list_relati.macro_sql:
{% macro postgres__list_relations_without_caching(schema_relation) %}
  {% call statement('list_relations_without_caching', fetch_result=True) -%}
    select
      '{{ schema_relation.database }}' as database,
      tablename as name,
      schemaname as schema,
      'table' as type
    from pg_tables
    where schemaname ilike '{{ schema_relation.schema }}'
    union all
    select
      '{{ schema_relation.database }}' as database,
      viewname as name,
      schemaname as schema,
      'view' as type
    from pg_views
    where schemaname ilike '{{ schema_relation.schema }}'
    union all
    select
      '{{ schema_relation.database }}' as database,
      matviewname as name,
      schemaname as schema,
      'materialized_view' as type
    from pg_matviews
    where schemaname ilike '{{ schema_relation.schema }}'
  {% endcall %}
  {{ return(load_result('list_relations_without_caching').table) }}
{% endmacro %}

macro.dbt_postgres.postgres__get_show_in.name: postgres__get_show_indexes_sql
macro.dbt_postgres.postgres__get_show_in.macro_sql:
{% macro postgres__get_show_indexes_sql(relation) %}
    select
        i.relname                                   as name,
        m.amname                                    as method,
        ix.indisunique                              as "unique",
        array_to_string(array_agg(a.attname), ',')  as column_names
    from pg_index ix
    join pg_class i
        on i.oid = ix.indexrelid
    join pg_am m
        on m.oid=i.relam
    join pg_class t
        on t.oid = ix.indrelid
    join pg_namespace n
        on n.oid = t.relnamespace
    join pg_attribute a
        on a.attrelid = t.oid
        and a.attnum = ANY(ix.indkey)
    where t.relname = '{{ relation.identifier }}'
      and n.nspname = '{{ relation.schema }}'
      and t.relkind in ('r', 'm')
    group by 1, 2, 3
    order by 1, 2, 3
{% endmacro %}

macro.dbt_postgres.postgres__get_relatio.name: postgres__get_relations
macro.dbt_postgres.postgres__get_relatio.macro_sql:
{% macro postgres__get_relations() -%}

  {#
      -- in pg_depend, objid is the dependent, refobjid is the referenced object
      --  > a pg_depend entry indicates that the referenced object cannot be
      --  > dropped without also dropping the dependent object.
  #}

  {%- call statement('relations', fetch_result=True) -%}
    select distinct
        dependent_namespace.nspname as dependent_schema,
        dependent_class.relname as dependent_name,
        referenced_namespace.nspname as referenced_schema,
        referenced_class.relname as referenced_name

    -- Query for views: views are entries in pg_class with an entry in pg_rewrite, but we avoid
    -- a seq scan on pg_rewrite by leveraging the fact there is an "internal" row in pg_depend for
    -- the view...
    from pg_class as dependent_class
    join pg_namespace as dependent_namespace on dependent_namespace.oid = dependent_class.relnamespace
    join pg_depend as dependent_depend on dependent_depend.refobjid = dependent_class.oid
        and dependent_depend.classid = 'pg_rewrite'::regclass
        and dependent_depend.refclassid = 'pg_class'::regclass
        and dependent_depend.deptype = 'i'

    -- ... and via pg_depend (that has a row per column, hence the need for "distinct" above, and
    -- making sure to exclude the internal row to avoid a view appearing to depend on itself)...
    join pg_depend as joining_depend on joining_depend.objid = dependent_depend.objid
        and joining_depend.classid = 'pg_rewrite'::regclass
        and joining_depend.refclassid = 'pg_class'::regclass
        and joining_depend.refobjid != dependent_depend.refobjid

    -- ... we can find the tables they query from in pg_class, but excluding system tables. Note we
    -- don't need need to exclude _dependent_ system tables, because they only query from other
    -- system tables, and so are automatically excluded by excluding _referenced_ system tables
    join pg_class as referenced_class on referenced_class.oid = joining_depend.refobjid
    join pg_namespace as referenced_namespace on referenced_namespace.oid = referenced_class.relnamespace
        and referenced_namespace.nspname != 'information_schema'
        and referenced_namespace.nspname not like 'pg\_%'

    order by
        dependent_schema, dependent_name, referenced_schema, referenced_name;

  {%- endcall -%}

  {{ return(load_result('relations').table) }}
{% endmacro %}

doc.enpal_assessment_project.is_active.name: is_active

doc.enpal_assessment_project.field_id.block_contents: Unique identifier for the field definition.

doc.enpal_assessment_project.field_value.block_contents: JSON options available for the field values.

doc.enpal_assessment_project.stage_id.block_contents: Unique identifier for the pipeline stage.

doc.enpal_assessment_project.stage_name.block_contents: Display name of the pipeline stage.

doc.enpal_assessment_project.first_call_.name: first_call_at
doc.enpal_assessment_project.first_call_.block_contents: Timestamp of the first completed sales call for a deal and call type.

doc.enpal_assessment_project.month_end.name: month_end
doc.enpal_assessment_project.month_end.block_contents: Month end date (last day of the month) used for monthly reporting buckets.

doc.enpal_assessment_project.month_start.name: month_start
doc.enpal_assessment_project.month_start.block_contents: Month start date (first day of the month) used for monthly reporting buckets.

doc.enpal_assessment_project.kpi_name.name: kpi_name
doc.enpal_assessment_project.kpi_name.block_contents: Funnel KPI label aligned to the sales process step.

doc.enpal_assessment_project.deals_count.name: deals_count
doc.enpal_assessment_project.deals_count.block_contents: Count of distinct deals reaching a funnel step during the month.

doc.enpal_assessment_project.sales_funne.name: sales_funnel_assumptions
doc.enpal_assessment_project.sales_funne.block_contents:
Assumptions: "Entered each funnel step" is defined as the first time a deal enters
the corresponding stage (or completes Sales Call 1/2) based on the earliest timestamp.
Monthly buckets are based on month-end dates derived from the event timestamp.

doc.enpal_assessment_project.sales_funne.name: sales_funnel_caveats
doc.enpal_assessment_project.sales_funne.block_contents:
Caveats: Activity completion relies on Pipedrive activity logging; missed or late updates
will shift counts. If stage names change, update the funnel mapping seeds to keep KPI
labels consistent.

doc.dbt.__overview__.name: __overview__
doc.dbt.__overview__.block_contents:
### Welcome!

Welcome to the auto-generated documentation for your dbt project!

### Navigation

You can use the `Project` and `Database` navigation tabs on the left side of the window to explore the models
in your project.

#### Project Tab
The `Project` tab mirrors the directory structure of your dbt project. In this tab, you can see all of the
models defined in your dbt project, as well as models imported from dbt packages.

#### Database Tab
The `Database` tab also exposes your models, but in a format that looks more like a database explorer. This view
shows relations (tables and views) grouped into database schemas. Note that ephemeral models are _not_ shown
in this interface, as they do not exist in the database.

### Graph Exploration
You can click the blue icon on the bottom-right corner of the page to view the lineage graph of your models.

On model pages, you'll see the immediate parents and children of the model you're exploring. By clicking the `Expand`
button at the top-right of this lineage pane, you'll be able to see all of the models that are used to build,
or are built from, the model you're exploring.

Once expanded, you'll be able to use the `--select` and `--exclude` model selection syntax to filter the
models in the graph. For more information on model selection, check out the [dbt docs](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/model-selection-syntax).

Note that you can also right-click on models to interactively filter and explore the graph.

---

### More information

- [What is dbt](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/introduction)?
- Read the [dbt viewpoint](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/viewpoint)
- [Installation](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/installation)
- Join the [dbt Community](https://www.getdbt.com/community/) for questions and discussion
